resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Society for Asian Music collection of noncommercial recordings [sound recording]</unittitle>
                  <unitdate>1959-1966</unitdate>
                  <unitid>*L (Special) 90-19</unitid>
                  <unitid>20481</unitid>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>Society for Asian Music</corpname>
                  </origination>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>The New York Public Library. Rodgers and Hammerstein Archives of Recorded Sound.</corpname>
                     <address>
                        <addressline>New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, Dorothy and Lewis B. Cullman Center</addressline>
                        <addressline>40 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023-7498</addressline>
                     </address>
                  </repository>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>108 sound tape reels</extent>
                     <physfacet>analog</physfacet>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>These music and spoken word recordings were collected under the auspices of the Society for Asian Music, and the contents of the recordings primarily concern Asian music, in both specific and general contexts. The Society was also the sponsor of many of the music recitals and lectures within the collection.</abstract>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Society for Asian Music collection of noncommercial recordings [sound recording] 1959-1966
resource.abstract: These music and spoken word recordings were collected under the auspices of the Society for Asian Music, and the contents of the recordings primarily concern Asian music, in both specific and general contexts. The Society was also the sponsor of many of the music recitals and lectures within the collection.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <repository>Archive of World Music, Eda Kuhn Loeb Music Library, Harvard College
				Library</repository>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>James Rubin</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>Collection of Indian classical music</unittitle>
                  <unitdate>1957-1989</unitdate>
                  <physloc>Archive of World Music</physloc>
                  <unitid>AWM RL 15077-16059</unitid>
                  <physdesc>Sound recordings (1120 reels, 431 discs) and accompanying materials (4 linear
				feet)</physdesc>
                  <abstract>Sound recordings made in India and America between 1957 and 1989. The collection
				consists mostly of Carnatic music with some programs of Hindustani music. These are primarily
				live concert recordings with a few programs recorded from All India Radio. Most of the
				recordings were made during the annual concert season in Chennai in December. Several were also
				made at the Tyāgarāja Arādhana Festival that takes place each January in the town of Tiruvayāṟu.
				The collection also includes copies of commercial recordings of both Indian and non-Indian music
				as well as a few miscellaneous recordings. The documentation consists of 32 small handwritten
				notebooks and 15 program books printed by the Music Academy. The collection also includes 431 78
				RPM records of Indian and Middle Eastern music as well as several books about Indian
				music.</abstract>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Collection of Indian classical music 1957-1989
resource.abstract: Sound recordings made in India and America between 1957 and 1989. The collectionconsists mostly of Carnatic music with some programs of Hindustani music. These are primarilylive concert recordings with a few programs recorded from All India Radio. Most of therecordings were made during the annual concert season in Chennai in December. Several were alsomade at the Tyāgarāja Arādhana Festival that takes place each January in the town of Tiruvayāṟu.The collection also includes copies of commercial recordings of both Indian and non-Indian musicas well as a few miscellaneous recordings. The documentation consists of 32 small handwrittennotebooks and 15 program books printed by the Music Academy. The collection also includes 431 78RPM records of Indian and Middle Eastern music as well as several books about Indianmusic.

nameEntries.original: Archive of World Music, Eda Kuhn Loeb Music Library, Harvard College Library
